content: Morning Rohan! Welcome back! Hope the trip wrapped up smoothly. How's the jet lag so far?
Thanks Ruby. Surprisingly minimal this time - your travel protocol really helped. Slept through the nightüôå
That's great to hear! I'll let Advik know - he's ready with your post-travel data debrief later today.
Hi Rohan, just pulled your Oura + Garmin data from the trip. Sending you a chart ‚Äî see how HRV dipped after the London flight? That's your autonomic nervous system adapting.
Yep, I can see the drop. What's the quick fix for that?
On high-stress/travel days, try a 5-min guided box breathing session before bed ‚Äî 4 sec inhale, 4 hold, 4 exhale, 4 hold. It helps reset your parasympathetic balance.
Easy enough. I'll try that tonight.
Quick note ‚Äî your DEXA scan is confirmed for Thu 10:00 at Mount Elizabeth Novena. I've arranged priority check-in so it's in-and-out.
Perfect, thanks for sorting.
Morning Rohan - I reviewed your food logs. New simple habit: start each day with 500ml water + pinch of sea salt before coffee. Supports hydration & focus.
Got it. Why the salt?
Small sodium bump helps retain fluids and supports electrolyte balance ‚Äî key for brain function, especially after sleep.
Makes sense. Will start tomorrow.
Rohan - initial results show ApoB at 110 mg/dL. Elevated. This is now our top priority to lower your cardiovascular risk. Plan will be built around this.
Understood. Thanks for being clear.
Noted ApoB as priority in your health dashboard - we'll align all habits & nutrition targets accordingly.
Quick one, Oura says my sleep score was 82, Garmin says 75. Which do I trust?
Both use different algorithms. Think of them as two perspectives. Our role is to be your single source of truth ‚Äî we synthesise all device trends into one coherent picture.
Got it. I'll leave the reconciliation to you.
Rachel's movement assessment is set for tomorrow 16:00 SGT. Link's in your calendar.
Thanks. Will be in the office but can find a quiet spot.
Morning! Just confirming your DEXA today at 10:00. Car is ready downstairs.
Hope DEXA went smoothly ‚Äî results will be in your consolidated report next week.
Yes, quick and painless. Appreciate the smooth bookingüôè
Nice work today - your squat shows some ankle mobility limits, likely from travel. First training block will target that for safer strength gains.
Didn't realise my ankles were part of the problem! Happy to work on it.
Morning check-in - how's the hydration + breathing routine so far?
Water is easy. Breathing‚Ä¶ I keep forgetting before bed.
Let's set a 9:30pm reminder for you. I'll coordinate with Sarah.
If the salt water feels bland, add a squeeze of lemon. Keeps it enjoyable so you stick with it.
Nice, will try that tomorrow.
Morning! Small win, your Oura HRV last night was the highest since your London trip üéâ
Good to hear. That breathing exercise might be doing something.
Rohan, great momentum this week. We've gone from collecting data to actually shaping habits, exactly where we want to be.
Feels like progress. Thanks team.
Monday we'll start integrating DEXA results with your other baselines - expect clear targets for the next 6 weeks.
Sounds good. Want to see the whole picture.
Absolutely. the aim is one clear action plan, no noise.
Closing the week strong! Hydration compliance 6/7 days, breathing 3/7. That's a start. We'll keep building.
Appreciate the quick recap!
